items.title: 3 Doors Downâ€™s Biggest Billboard Hot 100 Hits: â€˜Kryptoniteâ€™ &Â More
items.summary: A look at the bandâ€™s most key singles on the survey.
items.body: 3 Doors Down dominated Billboard â€™s rock charts in the 2000s and beyond, also crossing to pop formats and the upper reaches of the Billboard Hot 100 . As previously reported, Brad Arnold , a founding member and lead singer of the band, died on Feb. 7 following a battle with cancer. He was 47. â€œBrad helped redefine mainstream rock, blending post-grunge accessibility with emotionally direct songwriting and lyrical themes that resonated with everyday listeners,â€ the group shared in a statement. Related Brad Arnold, 3 Doors Down Lead Singer, Dies at 47 After Cancer Battle 3 Doors Down made its Billboard chart debut on Jan. 29, 2000, and went on to achieve five No. 1s among 13 top 10s through 2016 on the Mainstream Rock Airplay chart. â€œLoserâ€ led for 21 weeks in 2000-01 â€” the longest command in the listâ€™s history, which dates to 1981. On Alternative Airplay, the band has tallied four top 10s, including â€œKryptonite,â€ which ruled the ranking for 11 weeks in 2000. The actâ€™s combination of crunch and melody clicked with mainstream audiences, with three of its hits topping the Pop Airplay chart, among five top 10s: â€œKryptoniteâ€ (for five weeks in 2000), â€œWhen Iâ€™m Goneâ€ (one week, â€¦

items.title: Wigan, Wakefield and Bradford advance in Challenge Cup
items.summary: Wigan Warriors and Wakefield Trinity both score more than 80 points as fellow Super League sides Bradford Bulls and Catalan Dragons also reach round four.

items.title: How to Watch Super Bowl LX & Bad Bunnyâ€™s Halftime Show Online forÂ Free
items.summary: From the Super Bowl to the Benito Bowl, here's everything you need to know about NFL's big night.
items.body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. What a year it’s already been for Bad Bunny , from winning Album of the Year at the Grammys, to becoming the most streamed artists in the world, to dropping the best 2026 Super Bowl LX merch and now performing at the halftime show for NFL’s biggest night. With fans dubbing the special event “Benito Bowl,” the Puerto Rican star is set to make history today, Sunday (Feb. 8), which is now officially “Bad Bunny Day” in California, as he’ll be the first artist to perform primarily in Spanish while headlining the show. We don’t know exactly what surprises he has in store for fans, but Bad Bunny has teased that the halftime show “will be a huge party.” Pre- and post-Benito Bowl, there’s also an epic football gaming happening as well. The New England Patriots will face the Seattle Seahawks in an exciting Super Bowl XLIX rematch from 2015. How to Watch Super Bowl LX, At a Glance Kickoff Time: â€¦

items.title: Watch: Six Nations Rugby Special
items.summary: Highlights from this yearâ€™s Six Nations, including extended England v Wales analysis.

items.title: Arsenal end Man City's 13-game winning streak
items.summary: Watch highlights of Arsenal's 1-0 win over Manchester City as Olivia Smith's strike inflicts City's first Women's Super League defeat since the opening day of the season.

items.title: Ireland let Sri Lanka off the hook at World Cup
items.summary: Ireland cannot overcome a host of errors in the field as they fall 20 runs short of co-hosts Sri Lanka in their World Cup opener.

items.title: Ireland let Sri Lanka off the hook at World Cup
items.summary: Ireland cannot overcome a host of errors in the field as they fall 20 runs short of co-hosts Sri Lanka in their World Cup opener.

items.title: Saracens thrash Leicester as Quins and Exeter draw
items.summary: Saracens score 13 tries in an 81-0 thrashing of Leicester Tigers to keep up the pressure on Gloucester-Hartpury at the top of the Premiership Women's table.

items.title: Chelsea see off Tottenham to move third in WSL
items.summary: Goals from Keira Walsh and Alyssa Thompson ease Chelsea to a 2-0 victory over Tottenham to move the Blues third in the WSL.

items.title: Smith's versatility and 'contagious' positivity driving Arsenal
items.summary: Olivia Smith's talent and versatility is helping to kick-start a drifting Arsenal side back into life as they chase silverware on three fronts.

items.title: England's Feyi-Waboso could miss whole Six Nations
items.summary: England wing Immanuel Feyi-Waboso will miss the Calcutta Cup match against Scotland next weekend and is in danger of missing the entire Six Nations.

items.title: Frost hat-trick caps resounding Bath success at Sale
items.summary: Bath hooker Dan Frost scores a hat-trick of tries as the Prem Cup holders demolish Sale 60-19 to boost their hopes of securing a play-off spot.

items.title: Reed continues fine form with Qatar Masters win
items.summary: American Patrick Reed continues his fine form on the DP World Tour with victory at the Qatar Masters by two shots over Scotland's Calum Hill.

items.title: Sussex chairman quits in wake of points deductions
items.summary: Sussex chairman Jon Filby resigns in the wake of the county's financial difficulties, which have left them facing points deductions for next season.

items.title: England deny Nepal in final-ball World Cup thriller
items.summary: England fight from the brink to avoid a major shock and beat an inspired Nepal by four runs in their opening match of the T20 World Cup in Mumbai.

items.title: England survive scare to beat Nepal in World Cup thriller
items.summary: Will Jacks' late flurry of 39 runs off 18 balls proved to be key as England narrowly avoid a shocking upset against minnows Nepal, winning by four runs in their opening game of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.

items.title: Vonn crashes out of Winter Olympics downhill
items.summary: American skier Lindsey Vonn crashes in the women's downhill competition at the Winter Olympics, nine days after rupturing her left anterior cruciate ligament.

items.title: Pakistan officials meet ICC over India boycott
items.summary: Officials from the ICC and the PCB will meet in Lahore on Sunday for talks over Pakistan's planned boycott of their T20 World Cup match against India.

items.title: 'The shirt used to weigh heavy - now England players double in size in it'
items.summary: World Cup winner Matt Dawson discusses England's seven-try thrashing of Wales and the lessons coach Steve Borthwick can learn from France.

items.title: Rockers Pay Tribute to 3 Doors Down Frontman BradÂ Arnold
items.summary: The 3 Doors Down frontman died Saturday (Feb. 7) at age 47 after a battle with stage 4 kidney cancer.
items.body: Tributes from across the rock world have poured in following the death of Brad Arnold , the frontman of 3 Doors Down, who died Saturday (Feb. 7) at age 47 after a battle with stage 4 kidney cancer. Arnoldâ€™s death was confirmed earlier in the day by the rock group via social media, prompting messages of remembrance from fellow musicians who toured alongside him during the peak of post-grunge and hard rockâ€™s commercial dominance in the early 2000s. View this post on Instagram Among the first to publicly pay tribute was Brent Smith of Shinedown, who shared a video message recalling how 3 Doors Down helped his band early in their career. â€œYou guys were the first band that ever took us out on the road,â€ Smith said, referencing Shinedownâ€™s opening slot for 3 Doors Down in 2003. â€œBrad was always kind, always encouraging, and always real.â€ He captioned the post: “Thank you for the music. Thank you for the songs. Thank you for your love. Thank you for your friendship, and thank you for inspiring us all. May your light shine through all of time, and space forever.” Alter Bridge wrote, â€œThank you Brad, your friendship was one we will hold close forever. Until we meet again,â€ Seveâ€¦

items.title: Liverpool signing Jacquet injures shoulder
items.summary: Defender Jeremy Jacquet, who will join Liverpool at the end of the season, injures a shoulder in Rennes' defeat at Lens.

items.title: Rockets' Sengun sorry for sexist remark at official
items.summary: Houston Rockets centre Alperen Sengun says he has apologised to the female official he aimed a sexist remark at during a defeat by the Boston Celtics.

items.title: â€˜Bad Bunny Dayâ€™ Declared by Gavin Newsom Ahead of Super BowlÂ LX
items.summary: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has officially declared Feb. 8 â€œBad Bunny Dayâ€ across the state ahead of the singer's halftime performance.
items.body: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has officially declared Feb. 8 â€œ Bad Bunny Day â€ across the state, coinciding with Bad Bunnyâ€™s upcoming Super Bowl LX halftime performance in Santa Clara. â€œI am declaring tomorrow in California as â€˜Bad Bunny Dayâ€™ when Bad Bunny performs at the big game in the Golden State with his soothing, beautiful voice, and his very nice looks,â€ Newsom said via X on Saturday. Newsom later amplified his support with a tongue-in-cheek follow-up message, describing himself as â€œa tremendous lover of the Spanishâ€ and â€œa huge fan of Puerto Rico,â€ before adding, â€œWe love Bad Bunny! He is nearly as â€˜hotâ€™ as me â€” which is a big compliment, because there is nobody hotter. Happy Bad Bunny Day, America.â€ Support also came from Tim Cook, who praised the artist on social media ahead of the game in a selfie with the singer to social media. Bad Bunny, born Benito Antonio MartÃ­nez Ocasio, is set to deliver an all-Spanish halftime performance at Leviâ€™s Stadium during Super Bowl LX, marking one of the most prominent Spanish-language showcases in the eventâ€™s history. The appearance follows a landmark year for the Puerto Rican artist, who recently won Album of the Year at the 2026 Gramâ€¦

items.title: Backstreet Boys Share Bloopers, Behind-the-Scenes Video From T-Mobile Super BowlÂ Commercial
items.summary: The group chatted with Billboard ahead of the Super Bowl Sunday ad.
items.body: The Backstreet Boys bring a fun, reimagined version of “I Want It That Way” to T-Mobile’s 2026 Super Bowl commercial, which they filmed in New York City with a snowstorm looming. Related Backstreet Boys Warm Up to Sing on TV for Super Bowl Sunday in New Ad Teaser: ‘We’re So Back’ Inside the 2026 Super Bowl Parties: J Balvin, Diplo, Green Day & More Bad Bunny Ahead of Super Bowl: â€˜Iâ€™m Just a Normal Guy That Makes Musicâ€™ “We were hit with the winter storm right at the exact same time we were supposed to start filming,” BSB’s Nick Carter revealed in an interview with Billboard â€™s Tetris Kelly, noting, “There was a lot of adjustments that were being made at the time because we were supposed to do a two-day shoot.” That two-day schedule was condensed into one long day on set in the city at T-Mobile’s store in Times Square, where Carter says the temperature dropped to about six degrees, with snow imminent: “There’s a state of emergency basically in the city … The inside of the store was freezing. So every time that they opened the door it was like a wind tunnel, or like a refrigeâ€¦

items.title: Rock the Countryâ€™s South Carolina Stop Canceled After Several Artists ExitÂ Tour
items.summary: Anderson, S.C., was removed from the fest's schedule this week as the lineup shifted for the multi-date, Kid Rock-led event.
items.body: Amid Rock the Country’s lineup disruptions this week — with artists including Shinedown, Ludacris, Morgan Wade and Carter Faith making exits — the festival’s July 25-26 weekend in Anderson, S.C., is no longer on the schedule. Related Bad Bunny Is Playing the Super Bowl Halftime Show: Can We All Just Shut Up and Dance? Kid Rock Promises His Turning Point Halftime Show Will Be For People Who ‘Love Football, Love America, Love Good Music and Love Jesus’ Shinedown Pulls Out of Rock the Country Festival: ‘Our Band’s Purpose Is to Unite, Not Divide’ The South Carolina stop originally announced as part of an eight-city trek has been removed from Rock the Country’s website . Billboard reached out to a representative for Rock the Country for comment. Anderson County administrator’s was informed of the event being called off on Feb. 5, reports the Greenville, S.C., publication The Post and Courier . No specific reason for the cancellation was stated. As of Saturday (Feb. 7), the tour’s seven other stops remain on its schedule: Bellville, Texas (May 1-2); Bloomingdale, Ga. (May 29-30); Sioux Falls, S.D. (Jâ€¦

items.summary: Watch highlights as a hat-trick from Henry Arundell helps England dominate a disappointing Wales side in their opening Six Nations match.

items.title: Real Madrid step up Rodri interest - Sunday's gossip
items.summary: Real Madrid are stepping up interest in Manchester City midfielder Rodri, Arsenal are among clubs keen on Leon Goretzka and Manchester United and Newcastle target Michael Kayode, plus more.

items.title: 'Clutch' final jump gives Japan star big air snowboard gold

items.title: Green Dayâ€™s Billie Joe Armstrong Encourages ICE Agents to â€˜Quit That Sâ€”ty Jobâ€™ at Super BowlÂ Pre-Show
items.summary: The Bay Area trio took the stage at Pier 29 ahead of the big game.
items.body: Green Day â€™s Billie Joe Armstrong delivered a pointed political message during the bandâ€™s preâ€‘Super Bowl concert in San Francisco. During the punk-rock trioâ€™s performance on Friday (Feb. 6) at The FanDuel Party Powered by Spotify 2026 at Pier 29, Armstrong urged ICE agents to consider a different career path ahead of Sundayâ€™s (Feb. 8) big game between the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots. Related Donald Trump Berates Bad Bunny, Green Day Ahead of Super Bowl Performances: ‘I’m Anti-Them’ Bad Bunny Is Playing the Super Bowl Halftime Show: Can We All Just Shut Up and Dance? Green Day’s Billie Joe Armstrong Pledges Support For ‘Brothers and Sisters in Minnesota’ Amid Ongoing ICE Immigration Raids â€œQuit your sâ€”ty ass job. Quit that shitty job you have,â€ the frontman told the crowd . â€œBecause when this is over, and it will be over at some point of time, Kristi Noem, Stephen Miller, JD Vance, Donald Trump â€” theyâ€™re gonna drop you like a bad fâ€”king habit. Come on to this side of the line.â€ Armstrongâ€™s remarks appeared to be aimed at ICE agents who might be in the Bay Area for Super Bowl LX, where Bad Bunny will perform during halfâ€¦

items.title: Inside the 2026 Super Bowl Parties: J Balvin, Ciara, Green Day &Â More
items.summary: From Becky G to Travis Scott, see all the music stars that joined 2026's Super Bowl parties in San Francisco.
items.body: The Bay Area filled up with celebrities from every industry for the 2026 Super Bowl, set to take place at Leviâ€™s Stadium on Sunday (Feb. 8) â€” and music stars were not the exception. As spectators gear up for the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks game that includes a historic headlining Super Bowl halftime show by Bad Bunny , many parties took place across San Francisco leading up to the big event. Billboard was present at many invite-only events, including the FanDuel Party Powered by Spotify that featured two rocking performances by Counting Crows and Green Day . The latter â€” formed by Billie Joe Armstrong, Mike Dirnt and TrÃ© Cool â€” is set to kick off this yearâ€™s Super Bowl opening ceremony with â€œtheir most iconic rock anthems,â€ the NFL previously announced . Meanwhile, Apple Music, which is presenting the Apple Music Super Bowl LX Halftime Show on Sunday, kicked off the weekend with a celebration at Apple Union Square that included special guests such as J Balvin , Becky G , Diplo , Travis Scott and Luis Fonsi , as well as a set by Bad Bunnyâ€™s official touring deejay, DJ Orma. â€œI just want people to have fun,â€ Bad Bunny said during a press conference ahead of his big shoâ€¦

items.title: England's riot club focus on fine-tuning after walloping Wales
items.summary: Steve Borthwick has the pleasure of nit-picking through fine details after his England side swat aside Wales in their Six Nations opener.

items.title: Brad Arnold, 3 Doors Down Lead Singer, Dies at 47 After CancerÂ Battle
items.summary: The musician revealed his stage 4 kidney cancer diagnosis in May 2025.
items.body: Brad Arnold , a founding member and lead singer of 3 Doors Down , has died following a battle with cancer. He was 47. The musician passed away peacefully in his sleep on Saturday (Feb. 7), surrounded by his wife, Jennifer, and loved ones, the Mississippi-based rock band wrote on its official Instagram page. Related Gone But Not Forgotten: Musicians We Lost in 2026 3 Doors Down Singer Brad Arnold Reveals Stage 4 Kidney Cancer Diagnosis: ‘I Have No Fear’ 3 Doors Downâ€™s Biggest Billboard Hot 100 Hits: â€˜Kryptoniteâ€™ & More “As a founding member, vocalist, and original drummer of 3 Doors Down, Brad helped redefine mainstream rock, blending post-grunge accessibility with emotionally direct songwriting and lyrical themes that resonated with everyday listeners,” the band wrote in a statement. 3 Doors Down announced in May 2025 that Arnold had been diagnosed with stage 4 kidney cancer and that the band would cancel its summer tour. In a video posted to social media at the time, Arnold shared the news himself, noting that he was battling clear cell renal cell carcinoma, which had spread to his lungs. â€œI have no fear. I really, sincerely am not scareâ€¦

items.title: Ouattara scores late to give Brentford win over Newcastle
items.summary: Dango Ouattara scores in the 85th minute to give Brentford a 3-2 win over Newcastle United, as the visitors win their first game at St James' Park since 1934.

items.title: Everton produce second-half comeback to beat Fulham
items.summary: Everton score twice in the final fifteen minutes to secure a 2-1 away win over Fulham at Craven Cottage in the Premier League.

items.title: Teenager Rayan scores as Bournemouth draw against Villa
items.summary: Bournemouth come from behind to earn a 1-1 draw with Aston Villa, thanks to a goal from Brazilian teenager Rayan on his first start for the club.

items.title: Gyokeres scores twice as Arsenal beat Sunderland
items.summary: Viktor Gyokeres scores two goals as Arsenal comfortably beat Sunderland 3-0 to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points.

items.title: Romero red helps Man Utd continue perfect start under Carrick
items.summary: Goals from Bryan Mbeumo and Bruno Fernandes help Manchester United to a 2-0 win over 10-man Tottenham, who saw captain Cristian Romero sent off for the second time this season in the Premier League.

items.title: West Ham beat Burnley to boost survival hopes
items.summary: Goals from Crysencio Summerville and Taty Castellanos give West Ham a crucial 2-0 win against Burnley, to move them within three points of 17th-placed Nottingham Forest in the Premier League.

items.title: Palmer scores first-half hat-trick as Chelsea beat Wolves
items.summary: Cole Palmer becomes the first player in Premier League history to score three career first-half hat-tricks, as Chelsea see off Wolves 3-1 at Molineux.
